locations.name: Henrico County
locations.description: One of the original eight shires of Virginia, formed 1634. Named after Henry, Prince of Wales.

locations.name: St. Peters Parish
locations.description: Parish in Henrico County. Vestry records document early settlers.

locations.name: Arrowhattocks
locations.description: Region in Henrico County along the James River, named for the Arrowhattock Indians. Key settlement area for Johnson and allied families.

locations.name: Tuckahoe Creek
locations.description: Creek in the Arrowhattocks region. Michael Johnson and family settled along this creek by 1714.

locations.name: Cornelius Creek
locations.description: Creek in the Arrowhattocks region. Site of Burton family patents.

locations.name: Beaverdam Swamp
locations.description: Swamp area near Beaverdam Creek. Michael Johnson reportedly at this location by 1698.

locations.name: Edloe Plantation
locations.description: Plantation in the Arrowhattocks region. 1702 vestry entry shows Michael Johnson and John Jones listed as tithables here.

locations.name: Longfield
locations.description: Area in Henrico County. John Burton received patent here in 1665.

locations.name: Lily Valley
locations.description: Area in Henrico County. Robert Burton of Arrowhattocks and Lily Valley.

locations.name: Jordan's Journey
locations.description: Early plantation established by Samuel Jordan. Richard Johnson appears here in the 1624 muster.

locations.name: Strawberry Banks
locations.description: Area in Henrico County. Edward Johnson, Luke Johnson, and John Johnson documented here.

locations.name: New Kent County
locations.description: County formed 1654. Michael Johnson and John Jones may have come from here before moving to Henrico.

locations.name: Charles City County
locations.description: One of the original eight shires of Virginia.

locations.name: James City County
locations.description: One of the original eight shires of Virginia. Contains Jamestown.

locations.name: Goochland County
locations.border_notes: Western portion of Henrico. Further divided when Albemarle formed 1744.
locations.description: County formed 1728 from Henrico County. Some Arrowhattocks families moved here.
